action.title: Registration
action.description: Identifying and recording the subject of care.

action.title: Triage
action.description: Performing basic triage to identify any signs that emergency care is required.

action.title: Local Urgent Care
action.description: Providing local urgent care based on the outcome of a triage process.

action.title: History and Phyiscal
action.description: Gathering clinical history and performing and recording observations regarding the patient's health (e.g. blood pressure, temperature, etc.)

action.title: Provide Counseling
action.description: Informing the subject of care about their treatment options and about how their ongoing care should be managed between visits. This is also where treatment constents are obtained and where health education is provided.

action.title: Diagnostic Testing
action.description: Conducting diagnostic tests, including lab tests, collection of samples, and other diagnostic tests. Lab testing may be done locally (e.g. HIV quick test) or the samples may require lab order fulfillment workflow.

action.title: Determine Diagnosis
action.description: Using available information from the patient's history, current examinations, tests, and assessments to assist in developing a diagnosis.

action.title: Guideline-based Care
action.description: Performing and recording observations, interventions, and treatment plans recommended by specific guidelines.

action.title: Dispense Medications
action.description: Administering medications, ordered by clinicians and dispensed by a pharmacy. Pharmacies may be local to the care facility or community-based, and involves supply chain transactions to support medication management.

action.title: Emergency Care
action.description: Providing emergency care in trauma cases or as part of guildeline-based care escalation.

action.title: Acute/Tertiary Care
action.description: Providing acute or tertiary care, either as an escalation from emergency care, or from primary care due to guideline-based referral patterns.

action.title: Charge for Service
action.description: Charging for services rendered, regardless of the mechanism of coverage.

action.title: Discharge/Referral of Patient
action.description: Discharging or referring a patient, including the movement of patients through levels of care delivery (e.g. acute to primary, primary to community, etc.) or the enrollment of patients in guideline-based care programs (e.g. HIV, maternal, diabetes, injury rehabilitiation, etc.).

action.title: Record and Report
action.description: Recording and reporting patient-specific care management information which may be aggregated to develop reportable system management indicators at the priovider, facility, district, national, and international levels.

action.title: Monitor and Follow-up of Patient
action.description: Monitoring and tracking progress for each patient based on guideline recommendations.

action.title: Alerts Reminders Education
action.description: Providing alerts, reminders, and education to patients, providers, and health system managers.
